intro: Rubus tomentosus microgene tomenticaulis, commonly known as the woolly blackberry, is a shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its dense, silvery-white pubescence covering the stems, leaves, and fruiting structures. The leaves are typically trifoliate, with rounded lobes and a hairy surface. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in腋生 (axillary) inflorescences, while the fruit is a aggregate of small, dark red drupes. This plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
